intro: Lobelia alticaulis, commonly known as the alpine lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high elevations of the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Lobelia alticaulis plays an important ecological role in its native alpine ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
